text.text: How can users change a claim's date of service (DOS) in ZOLL Billing?

text: To change a claim's date of service, you can click the edit icon next to the service date on the Claim page. Then, you can select a new date from the calendar and click Save. You can change the date of service at any time before the claim is submitted.

text.text: Is there any specific restriction or limitation on when a claim's DOS can be changed?

text: You can change a claim's date of service on the Claim page at any time before the claim is submitted.

text.text: Can you describe the process for changing the DOS of a claim on the Claim page?

text: To change a claim's date of service, you can click the edit icon next to the service date on the Claim page. Then, you can select a new date from the calendar and click Save. You can change the date of service at any time before the claim is submitted.

text.text: Are there any audit trails or logs maintained for changes made to a claim's DOS in ZOLL Billing?

text: Yes, the company audit trail lists actions performed by ZOLL Billing users. You can't download the company audit trail, but you can print the page by right-clicking anywhere in the grid and selecting Print.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle claims that have already been submitted or processed with regard to changing their DOS?

text: ZOLL Billing automatically updates the claim status from Submitted to Follow-up - Un-adjudicated. This automatic change is based on the following number of days: 30 days after submission • Medicare & Medicare Replacement • Railroad Medicare • Medicaid & Medicaid Managed Care • Commercial Payers 60 days after submission • Auto • Workers Comp • Facility Payers • All non-primary claims (excluding patient) 90 days after submission • VA (90 days is set for the VA for both primary and non-primary claims).

text.text: Are there any implications or considerations to keep in mind when changing a claim's DOS, such as potential impact on billing or reimbursement?

text: If you replace the paid primary payer with the patient, the patient will receive statements for the full claim balance. You can still refund the original payer's money, even though the original payer is disabled.

text.text: Does ZOLL Billing provide any notifications or alerts to relevant stakeholders when a claim's DOS is changed?

text: When there are important messages that we want you to be aware of, a notification icon will display next to the Help link on every page.

text.text: Are there any best practices or guidelines recommended for users when considering changing a claim's DOS in ZOLL Billing?

text: The claim's date of service can be changed on the Claim page at any time before the claim is submitted.

text.text: Can users customize or configure any settings related to changing a claim's DOS in ZOLL Billing to align with their organization's specific workflows or policies?

text: Yes, users can customize or configure settings related to changing a claim's DOS in ZOLL Billing. Users can go to User Groups to view a list of the roles, create their own role, and to modify the pre-configured Billing role permissions if needed.

text.text: How does changing a claim's DOS comply with regulatory requirements and industry standards in healthcare billing and documentation?

text: When you queue the claim for submission, the submission does not include the money paid by the original payer.

text.text: How to change a claim's DOS?

text: To change a claim's DOS, you can click the edit icon next to the service date, click the service date field, select a new date from the calendar, and click Save.
